definition: brigand/(modern) uncivil driver/road hog/(PRC) person who sets up an illegal toll/(Tw) person who uses a part of the street as their private parking place
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

sentences.english: The Prussian Junker is the road-hog of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 普魯士容克就是歐洲的路霸。

sentences.english: Still, Chick wasn't going to let McQueen close in on him.
sentences.chinese: 可是，路霸還是不讓麥坤靠近自己，超過自己。

sentences.english: That Guy was driving down the center of the road being a hog; he hogged the whole road.
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙開車開在馬路中間象個路霸，霸佔了整條道。

sentences.english: But Chick Hicks wasn't about to lose this race to a rookie.
sentences.chinese: 路霸可不想在比賽中輸給一個新人。

definition: Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
Cheng Yaojin (589-665), aka 程知節|程知节[Cheng2 Zhi1 jie2], Chinese general of the Tang dynasty
